skill.name: slo-implementation
skill.description: Define and implement Service Level Indicators (SLIs) and Service Level Objectives (SLOs) with error budgets and alerting. Use when establishing reliability targets, implementing SRE practices, or measuring service performance.
skill.summary: Define and implement Service Level Indicators (SLIs) and Service Level Objectives (SLOs) with error ...

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns were found. Content is documentation and templates only, with no file access or network behavior.

content.user_title: Define SLOs with error budgets and alerts
content.value_statement: Reliability targets are often unclear and hard to measure. This skill provides SLI, SLO, and error budget templates with alerting guidance.
actual_capabilities: Explain SLI, SLO, and SLA hierarchy
Provide PromQL examples for availability and latency SLIs
Offer YAML templates for SLO targets and error budget policy
Define Prometheus recording rules for SLI and SLO compliance
Provide multi-window burn rate alert examples
Outline weekly, monthly, and quarterly SLO reviews
limitations: No automated data collection or deployment
Assumes Prometheus and Grafana style metrics
Reference files listed may be missing in this package
Does not calculate live SLOs from real data

use_cases.title: Set service reliability targets
use_cases.description: Define SLOs and error budgets for critical services and align teams on reliability goals.

use_cases.title: Add SLO alerts
use_cases.description: Create burn rate alerts and recording rules to detect SLO violations early.

use_cases.title: Review reliability trends
use_cases.description: Use SLO review cadence guidance to track reliability goals across releases.

prompt_templates.title: SLO basics
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the difference between SLI, SLO, and SLA for a web API and suggest one example SLI.

prompt_templates.title: SLO target setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose a 99.9 percent availability SLO for an API and show a PromQL SLI expression.

prompt_templates.title: Error budget policy
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an error budget policy with actions at 50, 10, and 0 percent remaining.

prompt_templates.title: Burn rate alerts
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft multi-window burn rate alerts for a 99.9 percent availability SLO using Prometheus rules.

output_examples.input: Create an SLO plan for an API service
output: Availability SLO at 99.9 percent over 28 days
PromQL SLI ratio for successful requests
Error budget policy with actions at 50, 10, and 0 percent
Fast and slow burn rate alert thresholds

best_practices: Start with user facing services and simple SLIs
Use multi window burn rate alerts to reduce noise
Review SLOs on a regular cadence and adjust targets
anti_patterns: Setting 100 percent SLOs without error budget
Using only internal metrics that do not reflect user impact
Ignoring error budget status when shipping risky changes

faq.question: What platforms does this work with?
faq.answer: It is platform agnostic but examples use Prometheus and Grafana style metrics.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and templates only, not automated SLO calculations or deployments.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing monitoring?
faq.answer: Yes, map the SLI formulas to your current metrics and alerting system.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it only provides static guidance and examples.

faq.question: What if my SLOs are frequently violated?
faq.answer: Lower targets, refine SLIs, and use error budget actions to prioritize reliability work.

faq.question: How does this compare to vendor tools?
faq.answer: It is a lightweight framework that complements vendor SLO products with clear definitions.
